intro: Acisanthera acisanthera, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Acisanthera acisanthera is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its vibrant and unique floral display.
